website_summaries.verdict: Versatile, flexible tripod for the adventurous photographer.
pros: Well-constructed ball head rotates smoothly while being strong enough to handle heavier cameras
Easy to get camera attached for quick shots
cons: After extensive use, the joints may begin to separate

customer_reviews.title: There is no effective warranty with JOBY.
customer_reviews.text: This was fantastic for a while. But after five months, it developed a stress fracture on the top knuckle making it so that one of the legs pops off and is extremely loose. Annoying sure, but it's well within one year warranty so I'm thinking, "No big, right?" Nope... wrong. After some weeks of contacting the email listed for warranty claims on JOBY's website I get crickets. Because Amazon is awesome (and prolly because I'm an irresponsible impulse buyer) they're accepting a courtesy return so I'll be alright, but be warned. Your tripod may only last a few months and don't count on JOBY to replace it if it does.
customer_reviews.author: San Gabriel Martin

customer_reviews.title: Using for canon 70D
customer_reviews.text: Didn't want to shell out the extra $$ for the larger version as I will be using this as tripod 90% of the time and not folding it around many tree branches. I'm using it with a canon 70D & Sony RX 100 M3. Although it is a bit of over kill for the Sony, it works great for the Canon. With that said, I am only using a 10-18mm lens and not a telephoto. I also don't have a mic or extra attachments on the 70D. So I didn't see the need for the larger version. Great quality gorillapod
customer_reviews.author: JPreviews

customer_reviews.title: Not made in Italy like the 3K Video Pro
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the Pro version because I saw the 3K Video Pro one in store and it was made in Italy. The 3K Pro is a similar design and also made from aluminum vs plastic, but is made in China. Not sure it's worth double the cost of the plastic standard 3K one. $100 seemed fair for made it Italy, but not for made in China. It is well made and sturdy, 3 stars for the price vs country of origin compared to the other models.
customer_reviews.author: Bloq

customer_reviews.title: Great little setup for iPhone 7+
customer_reviews.text: Bought this setup today for my iPhone 7 plus. I'd give it a 5 star because of the context of what I'm going to use it for. Now, it's not a manfrotto or vanguard so please don't expect that kind of quality tripod. But for a quick family group shot or even a "timed exposure" with the iPhone 7 plus raw shooting capabilities I think this is perfect enough for me and that's what I'll be using it for. Just to keep my phone steady. Here is a picture of my 7+ in a otterbox commuter case. Now if you buy this, be somewhat gentle with it. Don't play superman/supergirl while tightening the adjustments.
customer_reviews.author: Christian G.

customer_reviews.title: Great travel tripod--didn't last as long as it should have for the price
customer_reviews.text: We use this Gorillapod for vlogging, carrying our DSLR, wide angle lens and microphone--the weight of all this comes under 3kg, and yet this Gorillapod didn't really last any longer than a cheap knockoff I bought before this. I invested the money for the brandname hoping that it would be more durable, but that wasn't the case. Now I'm tentative to invest in the even more expensive Gorillapod if it's going to be so short-lasting! BUT, while it was working properly, it's a FANTASTIC tripod. So easy to set up in unconventional places and get creative with your filming or selfies.
customer_reviews.author: L. West

customer_reviews.title: Initially great, but falters soon after
customer_reviews.text: After less than a year of very light use, one of the ball sockets lost all its tension, rendering it close to useless. Homemade fixes proved to be futile. To be fair, I would expect the sockets to become loose over time (a year or more of moderate to heavy use), but not 6 months out of the box. There are lots of 4 and 5 star reviews - and that's great those customers have had positive experiences, just keep in mind this has the potential to be a complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Cory B.

customer_reviews.title: Ball head has too much friction and does not work properly.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for about 2 months and the product works well however I have one major issue. The ball and the rotating head. Once locked in place it is sturdy but within a few minutes if I release the tension in order to move the camera on the ballhead I have to put a great deal of pressure on the camera to swing it into another position. This should not be. Once I force it to move it moves freely but once locked down the same thing happens over and over again. I dont know why it happens. It should not happen. The balllhead has tremendous friction once released and movement is attempted.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce

customer_reviews.title: Can't support a DSLR : (
customer_reviews.text: I usually travel with a carbon fiber tripod, but wanted to try something more portable. The description said this would hold a SDLR. Nope, it doesn't. I have a (relatively light) Nikon D5300, and not particularly large/heavy lenses. The tripod didn't hold it. It would slooooowly sink. Major bummer. I'm sure it's good for point an shoots, but if you have a DSLR, you should pass.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Forsythe

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended for small P&S or mirrorless cams.
customer_reviews.text: First bought a cheapo imitation since I only used it with my phone. Then, got a new small Point and Shoot cam recently and figured i should have a better, more stable mini tripod. Clearly didn't know what I was missing until I got this. Great quality and excellent tripod!!! Regret spending the $10 on the cheapo imitation. This is easy to use, and most importantly, very stable. I use it with a Canon G7Xii and a Sony a6300 without problem. Only complaint, the screw mechanism that goes into the camera could be a better design (e.g., with a folding clip) so you don't have to have a coin to tighten (or in my case, strain my nails)
customer_reviews.author: jojo

customer_reviews.title: Nice tripod and vlogger on the go kit
customer_reviews.text: I love my tripod. It works phenomenonal. I thought it was not going to hold my camera but surprising it does hold my Canon 70D even with the battery pack. Now it's much lighter without the battery pack but it holds good. Take your time and use common sense when mounting you camera somewhere because the tripod won't defile gravity. It's easier to vlog on the go when you have this setup. Give a thumbs up if this review was helpful!
customer_reviews.author: Cal MTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty! A must have for your camera bag, beginer to professional.
customer_reviews.text: This little tripod is very well made and holds my Nikon DSLR as well as my iPad nicely. I read the reviews on knockoffs and it was a no brainer. I Purchased the one with the detachable ball head swivel mount and I am glad I did. I am able to point my camera straight down to get images of products I sell online and I have also use it for Time lapse. The bendable legs are great for those tough to mount locations. Wrap it around a pole or street sign and it stays put! It was worth every penny and I highly recommend it. A must have for any photographer beginer to professional.
customer_reviews.author: RoadDog

customer_reviews.title: Great little versatile tripod
customer_reviews.text: Overall I love it as a Vlog cam holder, especially for the versatility. It has been through a great many adventures with me over the years & it has stood up tot he test of time, but at this point the legs are super loose & sometimes pop off. Being that the little positional leg segments work on the principle of friction, they tend to loosen grip over time & substantial use. I still highly recommend if you're looking for something like this. I give sturdiness 4 stars because this issue has caused the tripod to fall over once causing my camera to fall into some sand when a leg "buckled." Sand & expensive cameras don't mix.
customer_reviews.author: TK-88

customer_reviews.title: Great Tripod for Daily Use
customer_reviews.text: I really love this tripod. It's sturdy enough to hold my Canon EOS M50 camera which is a pretty light mirrorless camera and thus far I've had no major issues with it. I am noticing one of the ball joints is getting a hair loose, but I'm looking into finding solutions to tighten that up. It hasn't caused any falls or anything. The ball joint head is a great addition that Joby included and I love it. The most difficult part is getting this thing level, but again, having that ball head with the level really makes it much easier.
customer_reviews.author: TechChucker

customer_reviews.title: Must Have for Low Perspective Photographs
customer_reviews.text: If you like to shoot low to the ground then this little item is AMAZING! I enjoy long exposures using my wide angle lens. I spent the entire summer trying to stabilize my camera on top of my camera bag when I decided to go low. Silly me..this little item has revolutionized my ability to shoot low. The ball head is great...a must have. Live this!
customer_reviews.author: Alissaspieces

customer_reviews.title: Wonderfully versatile, changes the POV of one's shots allowing for more creative, unique shots and shots taken from a childs POV
customer_reviews.text: Extremely durable, flexible and small profile. Easily transportable and a must for photographers who are hiking enthusiasts-- excellent for POV shots of nature. Have used it on a couple of trips and outings in the city. You will find more creative uses for it than those advertised on the case cover. The option to rotate from landscape to portrait in one simple move is one of the features I find most useful. Though it's quite small, its transportability, flexibility, and small profile is exactly what makes it so useful, to the point where you'll start asking yourself "how did i take pictures before I had this thing?"
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Has a durability issue
customer_reviews.text: At first, the tripod worked well for macro photography. The tripod’s legs are strong and durable, but the plate that connects the tripod to the camera is not. After about a dozen uses, the plate came apart, and I couldn’t snap the pieces back together. The plate is constructed of rubber, plastic, and a thin piece of stainless steel. JOBY claims the tripod can support 6.6 pounds. My camera plus lens weighs about 3 pounds, so I’m not overloading the tripod. A chain is no stronger than its weakest link, and the connecting pate is the weak link on this tripod. The connecting plate should be an all-metal, quick-release plate as is standard for conventional tripods.
customer_reviews.author: Kingfisher

customer_reviews.title: Tripod outlasted the ballhead
customer_reviews.text: Great tripod until the ballhead swivel broke off. Could reassemble either because the screws snapped. Tried JB welding it back together but need to have more filler for the two halves to stay together. Ballhead was used to hold an lg phone so weight wasn't an issue, just poorly made. Save your money and buy a different head.
customer_reviews.author: pennam ehere

customer_reviews.title: So handy!
customer_reviews.text: A must for stability if you like to drag your camera around everywhere so you don't miss "that shot". Dragging around a full tripod is impractical. But, this little guy is great! Flexible, light and gives that bit of stability to keep camera shake from ruining your focus. My husband loves it, and uses it all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Amy M Ralph

customer_reviews.title: Solid!
customer_reviews.text: this is a solid tripod. after i got this one, i ordered a competitor that looked very similar. the difference is night and day. The quality and sturdiness of this tripod is incredible. i live in Los Angeles, so i see lots of Vloggers and youtube personalities walking around, and I see this tripod the most. I asked a youtuber how long it lasts, and they say they contort this tripod for hours a day, everyday, and the quality maintains for about 6-8 months. then they just get a new one. so that sold me I use it a fraction of the time, and this thing is solid!!
customer_reviews.author: Cesar

customer_reviews.title: Great for everything
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy taking photos and videos with both my iPhone X and Nikon D5300. I bring this Tripod everytime I go out for a photo shoot or to take photos. With this tripod you can get into spots other tripods can not. You can also get some really cool angles thanks to the legs being adjustable. This is very sturdy as well. I am kinda clumsy and it has survived MANY drops from pretty high levels. Overall, a great tripod that I would recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Potts

customer_reviews.title: Your Go To Travelling Tripod for Many Purposes
customer_reviews.text: This gorillapod tripod has saved me from needing a huge tripod at times. Carrying this around during travels is a super essential piece of equipment. Pros: - Removable headpiece - Quick Eject & lock mechanism for camera mount - Gorilla Arms are strong to hold for big DSLR's Cons: - Decently priced but, this is a quality Gorillapod - Stiff Arms but, can also be a good thing too - Arms can break off and I've seem some heavy users duct tape it
customer_reviews.author: BrotherKehn

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with 2kg
customer_reviews.text: Sags and falls over when trying to hold my Nikon D7200 when I place it vertically. I weigh in at exactly 2kg with everything and it is an epic fail Sad but true. Overall it works well when attached to other fixtures, I just don't trust it over anything high or water...LOL Oh well, at least it works when horizontal.
customer_reviews.author: BigBobbyD

customer_reviews.title: So happy I bought this despite some of the critical reviews
customer_reviews.text: So happy I bought this despite some of the critical reviews. I'm using it with my Canon Rebel T6 and it works perfectly. It's super strong and is almost overkill for it, which is awesome. Maybe other people have bigger professional SLRs that are heavier, but that would be what the Gorillapod Focus is for. I love the ball head and the fact that the camera is detachable without having to unscrew it. And the level is handy. All in all, it holds the camera very securely and I'm happy I got it.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Flexible Tripod!!!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a tripod for my most recent trip to europe. this worked perfectly. first and foremost, i used this with my point and shoot canon, and my gopro. the bendable arms were strong and stiff, and managed to hug almost anything. it also helped while i was doing some filming in around the different cities, and it also fit perfectly in my backpack. i know that this particular tripod is big enough to handle a dslr as well, but in this case, it worked well for what i needed it for!
customer_reviews.author: randstarr

customer_reviews.title: Wears Down Easily
customer_reviews.text: At first, I really liked this tripod. It served its purpose and was small enough to fit in a backpack. The first irritating thing I noticed what that the middle piece would come lose and cause the camera to shake in the wind. It was easy to fix, just annoying. After owning it for a year now, the joints have loosened greatly and it actually slides around on a flat surface. One of the legs pops out when I try to bend it into position. I do really appreciate the level provided on the mount though, it came in handy.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Im sure it would work better w a small point and shoot but there are ...
customer_reviews.text: I think the concept is sound and Ive been looking for a small travel tripod but this not the answer. I was using a canon 6D and the head of the tripod broke the first time I used it, the spring popped out from the quick release then the plate separated from the metal support it sits on. Besides that I found it extremely hard and awakward to level. I had my doubts that it could handle a DSLR and it couldn't! Im sure it would work better w a small point and shoot but there are better options on the market. look up small travel tripods Manfrotto and basically any of those options will be better.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!!!
customer_reviews.text: Waited a year to write this review. I use this item with my cannon dslr all the time and it is perfect. It holds the weight of the camera while on poles, trees, golf carts, etc without worry. It hasn’t worn down or broken in anyway in the little over a year I have owned it. I would recommend this to anyone! Great buy
customer_reviews.author: jason Emond

customer_reviews.title: Great device, price however...
customer_reviews.text: The ball head is really what makes this thing great. The legs do hold the camera, even it unique places, but the ball head is strong and sturdy. It is expensive and I wish I could've saved some money. But other than that it is a great tripod. There are others a lot cheaper, but if you're gonna use it for a long time, and have a decently heavy camera, than this is worth it. The years and use you'll get with this is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Dominic DiNardi

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for the buck!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this gorillapod after wanting one for YEARS! Great buy! I've watched and read some reviews that even rate this one higher than the larger, Focus gorillapod. I can't personally say that this is better, but I can say that this tripod is extremely well built, it's durable and compact. And it will hold much more than what it says on the box. Great buy! I use this for filming videos on the go, as well as photography on the go. It's super convenient because it fits in like any backpack, and it's so nice being able to mount this thing virtually anywhere. Great buy for anyone that does a lot of video and photography shooting on the go.
customer_reviews.author: BenTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great portable tripod
customer_reviews.text: This tripod is excellent due to its small size and capability to get twisted into nearly any position. It's also a great bonus to be able to attach to objects such as tree branches and fence posts. When attached, my dslr feels very stable and allows me to take photos in situations where I could not in the past. Each "ball" of the pod itself is stiff yet flexible. The Inclusion of the level on the ball-head is also a nice touch. Also, the space saving that this gives me over a tripod is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew MTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Best Tripod for Vloggers
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much any YouTube Channel you watch, these are being used and there is a good reason why. They are sturdy, stable and flexible with out being flimsy. They are latch on to all sorts of objects and stay put. The mount allows you to spin the camera 360 degrees with out moving the whole tripod base. These head also allows you to tilt your camera on its side for a vertical shot or just to level out on sloped terrain. Every vlogger or Photographer needs at least on of these in their quiver.
customer_reviews.author: The Grubb Show

customer_reviews.title: Good product (recommend it ONLY for small camera and lens)
customer_reviews.text: The tripod has good quality and light weight. I think it might be good for small cameras. However, I tried it with my Canon EOS R + EF 16-35mm, even the total weight is just about 3 lbs, the tripod can't always hold them firmly.
customer_reviews.author: dan

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised by how sturdy and practical this is
customer_reviews.text: Been meaning to buy one of these for a few years now. I always thought they were flimsy and one of those short-lived novelty ideas, so I was really pleasantly surprised by how sturdy and well-made it actually is. This thing holds my Nikon D3200 like it's a feather. I needed it to stabilize my camera as I take a lot of micro photos and they come out blurry, so this is amazing. Plus, I can actually throw it in my bag and take it anywhere, which is always a plus. Between this and the Nikon wireless mobile adapter, I think I'll be all set.
customer_reviews.author: Lina

customer_reviews.title: Ok option for a flexy tripod
customer_reviews.text: It's alright for vlog filming and for odd surfaces. I found it a bit to easy to snap parts of the legs off; they click back on but it became less stable and less indestructible after pieces snapped off. I don't think I was crazy rough on it; although I might've been 🤷‍♂️
customer_reviews.author: Joe S

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, strong, and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: This tripod is excellent. Easy to use, and very stable - so much so that I can let my two-year-old use it (see photo). It can handle my heavy DSLR as well as our small camera, and can be wound around tree branches and used in other creative ways to get that perfect shot.
customer_reviews.author: mamasmiles

customer_reviews.title: A great tool for better pictures. I use it for everything from DSLRs to GoPros.
customer_reviews.text: A great tool for better pictures. I have used it for a full size DSLR with zoom lens, but most of the time its holding a GoPro. With the longer legs, I can usually find something to mount it securely to pretty much anywhere. The ball head holds firmly and is easy to adjust. We have had several Joby pods. They are far better that the look a likes that are available. I had one Joby GorillaPod to crack once. (I'm pretty rough with them) I contacted them. They ask for a picture of the damage, and then sent me a new one, without a problem. I would recommend this product. Great customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Morrowdad

customer_reviews.title: Joby GorillaPod SLR Zoom Tripod with Ball Head.
customer_reviews.text: This GorillaPod and Tripod combo is wonderful. It supports upwards of 6 pounds. It has a bubble leveler. I have used it to mount my cameras on or around various things, such as poles, cars, stairs, etc... You can use it as a selfie-pod. It is very light weight. Stands a little over 1 foot tall. This is able to support my Nikon D3300 with kit lens and Rode VideoMic Pro all the way down to my sony action cam. If you need something more sturdy, the Black GorillaPod with BallHead can support up to 12 pound rig and sits a couple of inches taller. This is my next GorillaPod purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Marvin TolentinoTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Achieving proper balance is a pain.
customer_reviews.text: Great concept, but getting it level without a rotating head is a pain. You'll spend the majority of time stretching this leg and that leg for a good while. I recommend the original and cheaper version. Works much better while out in the field.
customer_reviews.author: Roger R.

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: This little tripod is a beast. Holds up my DSLR (D3300) with ease. The ball head works great, the tripod legs have a great grip on each ball and allow you to grip onto almost any surface (think around a railing, hand rail, tree branch, etc.). I recommend this for someone traveling who does not want to bring along a big full size tripod. This in no way replaces a full size tripod if you are a serious photographer, but it absolutely gets the job done and holds the camera in place and steady. I would buy again and recommend to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: MikeyBuysAlot

customer_reviews.title: I really like the Job GorillaPod.  Would definitely recommend
customer_reviews.text: I think this is the best bendy tripod out there. I got a Canon EOS T6i and this works GREAT with it. It's so solid feeling, and I never feel like it's going to fall over. Just have to make sure the legs are in a good position before standing on it's on. It's great to use when you want to put the tripod on a pole or in an obscure location that a normal tripod wouldn't be able to stand on its own. It's also very portable since it's only about 15 inches tall, so you can easily carry it around with you when you're out and about.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected, but does not appear to be high quality and it's not very light.
customer_reviews.text: The plastics used in this model seems a bit chintzy. For the price you'd think that the material and construction quality would be better. It is functional and performs as expected, but we'll see how it performs in terms of long-term durability. I intended to use this on back-packing trips, so it is also a bit heavier than I would have liked. If I need to replace this, I suspect that I will look for lighter and higher quality alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: Andy T

customer_reviews.title: Great accessory.
customer_reviews.text: I only wish it was a bit longer. It is very sturdy, can hold my D5500 with a wide angle lens in all positions, struggles with certain positions when I put on the 70-200mm 2.8 Tamron lens. If you know the size of this one you'd be surprised it can hold it at all. It is a great accessory but will, of course, not replace a real tripod. I have really profited from it when hiking with the family and already overloaded with kids stuff and at a recent wedding where I was able to mount it to other equipment on stage without taking up further space.
customer_reviews.author: RemiGoose

customer_reviews.title: This is a great little tripod!
customer_reviews.text: Well made, easy to use. I have had a Bogenschut tripod for 25 years that I hate using because it is so restrictive. This little tripod is a dream. I only wish it had a pano function. That would be amazing. It connects to camera securely and the little mounting plate can be removed and slides right back into the tripod again. I've left it on my camera. Will take this with me everywhere!
customer_reviews.author: tiffany-b

customer_reviews.title: Perfect travel companion
customer_reviews.text: First ordered the more expensive model with the ball head. It broke on first use after waiting a month for it to be delivered. This one, a little less weight, stiff but properly flexible. So far it's been wrapped around fence rails and set up on the cliffs of canyons without ever moving in light winds. The head is easy to adjust when the base is uneven. The level on the plate is a little too small for my tastes but is a nice touch! I love its solid construction and how it fits perfectly into my camera bag.
customer_reviews.author: The Vegas Tourist

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy Gorillapod
customer_reviews.text: The sockets are made from Aluminum, so this Gorillapod is sturdier than the last one I had.
customer_reviews.author: Vegäs Gär ✅

customer_reviews.title: This tripod = Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I’ve never owned a tripod before and this thing does everything. I wrap this thing around anything you can think of and it holds tight. The ball head makes it super easy for adjustments while you’re shooting. I know this thing has been around for a long time but I’m so glad I made the purchase. Also comes with a level bubble on the tripod mount so you know you’re good. The only thing I worry about is will the legs loosen up over time. I guess only time will tell. All in all I’m super happy with this tripod and will definitely be buying products from this company.
customer_reviews.author: John Doherty

customer_reviews.title: Nice Idea, Haven't Utilized as Much as I Thought
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used this as much as I thought I would. I thought I would use it on vaca a lot, however I quickly found out on tour things move quickly and there isn't time or places to set this up. It makes me a bit nervous to put an expensive camera dangling from precarious locations. However, after one use one of the legs remains permanently kinked, although it is still usable.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn L

customer_reviews.title: This IMO is the best gadget I have bought for my camera
customer_reviews.text: This IMO is the best gadget I have bought for my camera. WOW!! I used this extensively on my last vacation and being able to put this little gem anywhere without occupying too much space is awesome. I use a Sony A6000 which is a small lightweight camera with this, but I have paired it with my Nikon 300mm AIS (quite heavy lens) and holds it very steady.
customer_reviews.author: rquiles

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: Two times I have bought knock off gorilla pods and both times they have broke or just been a bad item. Totally worth investing in the Joby brand. I've been impressed with how nice it is, and the ball head is smooth. Really really enjoy this for vlogging and the build quality has been totally reliable. Been very happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: Backcountry Exposure

customer_reviews.title: I love the versatility of this
customer_reviews.text: I love the versatility of this, but only gave it three starts because the first pod on each leg cracked within months of use and made it practically useless as intended. I ended up putting a sh*t ton of super glue on the it to get it to work properly. I love it other than that though.
customer_reviews.author: NathanW

customer_reviews.title: READ THE OTHER 1-Star Reviews; These break!!!
customer_reviews.text: I initially loved this product until it one day randomly broke apart as I was attaching it to my DSLR. I'm talking springs popping out of the top and everything. I tried to piece it back together but the plastic top piece will not hold. Completely useless now.
customer_reviews.author: J. Puder

customer_reviews.title: No Customer Service when it comes to Warranty Replacement or Repair
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this tripod back in May 2018 and this month (October 2018) i noticed that one of the legs was not holding up. there is a small crack in one of the ball joints. I emailed and called Joby warranty support twice for a replacement or repair and nobody has gotten back to me. I would suggest this product because the product is great, but the customer service sucks...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not really strong enough to handle a zoom lens.
customer_reviews.text: This is fine for a point-and-shoot, but while they say it is for SLR zoom, I can't use this with my Canon 6D with a 24-105 lens attached. It collapses. Also, the legs become noticeably weaker after a few months of use. Not really a great deal. You can get a decent regular, Chinese-made tripod for the same amount of money.
customer_reviews.author: D. Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Grippy and good
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know how I made it this far as a photographer without one of these. Next I want to get a mount for my phone as well to put it on this thing. Great light tripod for hiking and mounting on a tree or whatever to take a photo. Wrapped it around my mail box in the front yard to get reactions to the total eclipse the other day. Thick construction seems very sturdy and it’s quite grippy.
customer_reviews.author: Duke

customer_reviews.title: Best Portable Tripod!!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best portable tripods on the market. Truly sturdy and mountable anywhere!! Literally. You just have to be creative, while having a great understanding of gravity and opposing forces. lol Just buy it. Go! Right now. - Fits in almost every book bag - Perfect (one size) selfie stick - Sturdy build - Comes with an air bubble balance - Neutral colors FTW
customer_reviews.author: Julio Caezar

customer_reviews.title: There's a Reason its #1....
customer_reviews.text: This is the best tripod I have owned hands down. It is so useful when on the go and need something light and compact. Not to mention its versatile, you can attach it to a railing, a tree, or pretty much anything for that matter which makes it so great. I've used this to shoot time lapses in my car attaching it to the dash and it doesn't budge at all. I would recommend the ball head it allows you to easily get the camera level, without fiddling with the legs for minutes and it has a built in level which is a nice touch.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Z

customer_reviews.title: Great versatility. A little bulky.
customer_reviews.text: I love the versatility of this tripod, in the multiple configurations you can do to help diversify your shots. It can act as a selfie stick, and the rotating head can help with the angle of the shot. If you just want your camera alone you can easily disengage the camera mount from the tripod. The tripod is a good size to fit a regular backpack. The cons of this is that is does add some weight for on the move shooting/ vlogging. I also agree with a previous reviewer it does take some time to get a leveled shot.
customer_reviews.author: Mike M.

customer_reviews.title: Seven year durability review.
customer_reviews.text: Why change a great thing? I purchased the JOBY nearly 7 years ago! It's been used extensively with various Sony portable cameras. I'd expected the ball joints would have failed ages ago. I'm pleased to state that it holds its shape as well as the day we purchased it. Do not hesitate to buy the GorillaPod.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tripod for tough-angle shots
customer_reviews.text: This has the be one of the best Tripods you can buy. The ball joint under the camera is priceless - and the sturdiness of the tripod itself makes this thing feel extremely nice. Everything on it feels and works perfectly - and the only small flaw I can think of would be the length. (It's a little shorter than I expected). I love how smooth and tight each individual joint moves - it's not so tight that you can't adjust it - but it's tight enough that you don't have to worry about any camera movement at all, even in strange positions.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Maxwell

customer_reviews.title: Great tripod. But don't break it!
customer_reviews.text: I over extended one of the legs and it cracked at the base where the three legs meet. Be careful not to over extend. It became slightly looser as a result. Still usable but I expected this thing to be a beast after all the accolades about the GorillaPods. This thing does grip on tight to a lot of stuff which is the selling point. I also have a MeFoto mount that works well with the tripod (although it makes the setup look a little long).
customer_reviews.author: Kian

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: Four weeks after I received it, the base fell apart as I was unscrewing my camera from the tripod. The springs fell out and I now have the base taped together (see image) in order to keep it functional. I thought Joby was a high-quality product which is why I was willing to pay more than the competing tripods. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Benzi Ronen

customer_reviews.title: Youtuber brother loves this tripod!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my brother who runs a youtube channel. [...] He vlogs daily and uses his Canon G7x with this Joby and he couldn't be happier with it! Its really nice when you need to setup your camera in a weird way or just want that little extra extension for a bigger field of view. He really likes it and wants the bigger size next for his Dslr. go check his channel out if you want to see the tripod in action! youtube.com/itsandrewson
customer_reviews.author: David Son

customer_reviews.title: Great small Tripod
customer_reviews.text: Just what I wanted I bought a smaller tripod with solid legs and was surprised that it was unstable because the legs bent with the weight of the camera lens this does not. I used it with my Sony A6000 and 18 - 200 lens about 2 pounds and it did great you can adjust the legs anyway you want. The ball head locks down solid and does not move. the head has a removable plate so the camera just slides right in to the head and locks down . If you need a small tripod and have a smaller camera this would work well for you
customer_reviews.author: John WenzelburgerTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Seriously Love This!
customer_reviews.text: I am new to videography. Just bought my first good camera which is a Sony a6400 with and 18-105 lens and Rode Video Micro and it holds it with no problem so far. Watched tons of videos and everyone kept recommending this tripod. I got it over the Switch Standbecause of the flexibility of it. Really loving this tripod!
customer_reviews.author: richard galiguis

customer_reviews.title: Nice for small cameras or off-camera flash.
customer_reviews.text: Works well to mount small cameras or off-camera flash in various situations. Ideal for GoPro or point & shoot sizes. Will hold Canon Rebel DSLRs, but 7DII or 5DIII bodies with L lenses may move due to weight. Works in a pinch for heavier cameras but not really designed for it, so use at own risk. I've carried it for travel, but found it is bulky. So, would rather pack a compact tripod in the future.
customer_reviews.author: AJK

customer_reviews.title: Its pretty good
customer_reviews.text: I like this tripod but the head is basic and a little small, also it does not hold my Sony a7ii with canon glass on its legs. I can vlog style grip it and it is fine but I will not be able to mount my sony on anything with this version. Plus I would feel better if it was metal. Next version will the be the heaviest one.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: That it supported my camera and lens, don’t need my high dollar camera and lens falling into river.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Got real low with it on some rocks, to photograph a water fall, and used it to wrap around a bridge rail to stabilize the camera, with a heavy lens. And it worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: Beau Diddly

customer_reviews.title: Scenery, wildlife and selfies...  Oh My!
customer_reviews.text: This is my go-to for photography in the backcountry, which is how I earn part of my living. Light and flexible, it is easy to carry and use in a variety of conditions/terrain. If you're doing wildlife photography and need your camera at the ready, it is light enough to keep attached to the camera around your neck. Otherwise, with the attachment screwed into the bottom of your camera it snaps on quickly and easily. It's also handy for group photos and selfies using a remote or self timer.
customer_reviews.author: Wild Celtic Rose

customer_reviews.title: Versatile tripod
customer_reviews.text: Got this tripod as a gift for a friend. She's very pleased with it. I was able to use it myself and I was impressed by it's versatility. It bends and wraps in all sorts of directions so you can get just the precise angle for your shot, even if you're in an awkward area/position. No problems attaching it to a dslr. Would recommend to anyone looking to get a steady shot in tricky, non-flat areas
customer_reviews.author: Sue T.

customer_reviews.title: Only held up for 3-4 months
customer_reviews.text: After that, the balls became loose and eventually one leg came off compeltely. Very dissapointed, I can't even return it now. I am using a Canon under 5 pounds. I used it frequently for vlogging, but it should hold up. Definetely does not.
customer_reviews.author: AfroMom

customer_reviews.title: easy to use and very durable
customer_reviews.text: easy to use and very durable. Joby gorilla pod is able to hold my t6i, G3x, and rx100m4 just fine. I like using it and it has upped my photography game !. Also it works as extra points to steady your video just adjust the legs like they are handle and press one against your chest. The quick detach plate is awesome and easy to use. The ball head is very good quality and good for quick pans.
customer_reviews.author: William Sung

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing, if you can only buy one piece of gear, Buy This!
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite Camera fear piece I have ever bought. I saw a few episodes with Casey Neistat using so i placed an order. This has been best investment, i have owned steadicam, shoulder rigs, tripods, selfie sticka and random strangers to hold gear. This converts to sholder rig easily, handheld rig, tripod, wrap around a tree branch or rail and you can use virtually anywhere. BUY THIS!!!
customer_reviews.author: Zona562

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this thing! It is uber handy in tons of situations. I do some vlogging and do lots of home video style shooting and it is awesome. I don't have to hold on to my video camera with both hands, I can set up my camera in crazy locations, and it is solid as a rock. The ball joint is perfect for the subtle corrections that you can't get just by moving the legs.
customer_reviews.author: Stephane Budge

customer_reviews.title: Tripod is a great size. The legs are a little stiff
customer_reviews.text: Tripod is a great size. The legs are a little stiff, but it's functional. I prefer this tripod than the old one I have. Legs are flexible and it's been very sturdy so far. Some parts are plastic that I wish they weren't, but I can't do anything about it. It fits perfectly on my camera bag as well.
customer_reviews.author: Kribby

customer_reviews.title: Good arounf stuff, not perfect on flat surfaces
customer_reviews.text: I have a Nikon D7000 with an 18-200 lens, so a bit heavy package, and this guy sometimes slowly tilts on flat surfaces. If instead you have a grip on something like a char, a branch, a pole, whatever, it's great! I bought the one with the level indicator on the ball so much easier to set it up quickly (the ball head has quick-release). Some reviewers complain about getting it back straight and it's true that if you're in a hurry you won't be able to - just learn to live with a semi- straight tripod, though I guess you could invest time and effort at home later (but why?)
customer_reviews.author: cfc

customer_reviews.title: Great but i'm having a hard time loving it.
customer_reviews.text: It's a tripod, it's a selfie stick, it's a tripod selfie stick! All jokes aside it's not bad, it does the tripod duty, for vlogging you need a SUPER wide angle lens to use in conjunction with this tripod, especially if you're using it as a selfie stick for vlogging because the distance between you and the camera will not be significant.
customer_reviews.author: Grant

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a few months of use and cut my hand open
customer_reviews.text: Loved it for the first few months then the legs started to fall off. Then at a community event the camera started to fall off. As I caught the camera the attachment piece fell apart and cut my hand open. I’m fine, as well as the camera, but I just threw it away. Save your money and get the real thing or wait for better alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: Charles W.

customer_reviews.title: However....
customer_reviews.text: The first bullet point of functionality states: Adaptable Screw: attaches to cameras with 1/4" or 3/8" tripod thread. What that really means is that IF you remove the ball head, there's an adapter, already in use for their ball head. You can remove the ball head if you need to attach a device with a 3/8" mount. Otherwise, it's good. I bought it mainly for my Zoom H4n or my Canon G12 when I travel, and it should work great for these uses. I doubt I'll trust it to my 7d or 5dMkII, but with a prime lens it would probably be sufficient.
customer_reviews.author: Louroy

customer_reviews.title: From hesitant to total believer
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! Bought this for a portable solution for a travel photography gig in Israel and it worked great. Having heavy, Nikon pro gear, I was hesitant but it worked so well shooting a sunrise on the Sea of Galilee, photographing city scenes at night and capturing hotel settings in the evenings.
customer_reviews.author: D. Linscott

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Tool! Innacurate level
customer_reviews.text: The tripod itself paired with the zoom mount is excellent. Its very sturdy comes in handy in so many ways. My only issue is the level that comes attached to the zoom mount... Definitely NOT level when it says it is. This is really not that important to me simply because you should be able to use the in camera grid lines to determine if you are level or not. Could be useful , but the last thing this is is a deal breaker.
customer_reviews.author: Micheal Harrington

customer_reviews.title: It's handy, but needs a new mechanism to tighten the quick release plate
customer_reviews.text: It is quite handy to carry this tripod around, particularly for low angled landscape shots, which give a quite different point of view. I haven't tried wrapping it around a pole to test its abilities. But I am a bit hesitant. Who designed the quick release plate? It looks like you would need a screw driver to tighten the plate at the bottom of the camera. If you don't do that, the loose plate causes the camera to tip over from portrait mode to landscape mode, thereby ruining your photograph! Plus, even when the camera is horizontal, the loose plate may still cause it to rotate around!
customer_reviews.author: Vinay

customer_reviews.title: If you need a small tripod... these work
customer_reviews.text: Just so you know, the GP3 Gorillapod is the only one rated for a hefty digital camera/zoom lens/strobe combination. The smaller ones will tip over and probably break stuff. No problems with this unit, glad I read the fine print on other reviews! I shoot a Sony a55, with 18-250mm Sigma lens, and sometimes the Sony 58 strobe - a total of around 4 pounds of glass and parts - and this little pod just takes a likkin' and keeps on tickin' Edit - 1/9/13, somehow the GorillaPod got crunched in the back of my car and is no more. It smashed in hundreds of pieces, not sure how. Care for your toys!
customer_reviews.author: A. R. Jonez

customer_reviews.title: good idea, bad quality
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this January of 2017. I used this mostly with GoPro and iPhone 7+, but by March, I had few of the sockets cracked at the seam. at that point, i couldn't use it with my Sony A6000. Today, (May of 2017), i need to order a replacement. i think the manufacturing technique or material needs to change, or i can't really order the same replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Good device. But to pricey and fragile.
customer_reviews.text: I have to be honest. This is a great product for both my YouTube videos and Instagram account. But one of the legs broke less than a month. Thank God for the warranty. Be careful with using this device. It may damage your camera.
customer_reviews.author: Ariole Dieujuste

customer_reviews.title: Product came with excellent shape. But I do not feel safe mounting ...
customer_reviews.text: Product came with excellent shape. But I do not feel safe mounting my Canon 6D II, EF 24-70mm II USM lens on this tripod. Ended up purchasing Sirui T-025X for the same portability plus it's stability. I would say it will be safe if you are just mounting the same camera and lens just for hand held like vlogging purpose or wrap it on some pole but not putting it on the flat ground. Because I may afraid that it will not withstand the strong wind.
customer_reviews.author: Tan Jun Hao

customer_reviews.title: I love this little tripod I am a YouTuber And I ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this little tripod I am a YouTuber And I use this To hold vlog camera To get a little farther From my face. It works Amazing. It's also great To set up quick Little walk by shots For montages. PlusYou can get it to do some pretty smooth Pending motion As well. You can check out It in action On my channel sam angello
customer_reviews.author: Sam Angello

customer_reviews.title: I no longer need to contemplate taking my full-sized tripod into the wilderness...I just take this every time!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, and just as versital as the photos demonstrate. A must for any photographer on the go! I use it as both a standard tripod, and as a stabilization rig against trees and boulders. I have captured many shots at a higher stop than otherwise would have been possible, without the need to lug a full tripod into the wilderness. Be sure to note whether you are purchasing the model with or without a bubble level and ball joint. I paid a few dollars extra for the bubble level and ball joint, and am glad I did; it would not be the same product without them.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: I love the idea of a gorilla pod for my DSLR ...
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea of a gorilla pod for my DSLR but this one just didn't quite work. At it's current size (which I imagine is large because it needs to support larger cameras), it didn't fit in my standard camera case and was relatively bulky to setup. I think you'd be just as well off getting a normal, foldable tripod.
customer_reviews.author: ShoppingLover89

customer_reviews.title: This is small and is easy to take with you where ever you travel
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly for filming in crazy places. Sometimes a regular tripod can just be too much to carry around. This is small and is easy to take with you where ever you travel. The only downside might be that in certain situations since it is not like your normal tripod, you might find yourself placing on top of other things because it doesn't have legs that extend to a certain height. But other than that, it's awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: A must have for anyone going into rocky or uneven terrain.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is spectacular. I took it with me to Niagara Falls for the first time and not only is this thing sturdy enough to hold up my Nikon D3200 but the legs are strong enough to hold it up at multiple hanging angles. One of my absolute favorite camera accessories so far. Took it into the gorge and this thing was a champ hanging from branches, or sitting on jagged boulders to get an even, perfect shot. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Belerophon

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little Gorillapod
customer_reviews.text: This tiny flexible tripod is most amazing. I have taken several night shots from the third floor terrace and the grip is amazing and it is also flexible and can be adjusted at all angles. It holds the weight of my DSLR with its 55-22mm zoom lens without any problem. It is a must for travel. I am more than satisfied. It is exceptional
customer_reviews.author: cress

customer_reviews.title: Really like this bendable tripod
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight yet sturdy construction. Easy to use and holds it's shape well, and attaches and removes easily via the quick clip. The adjustable ball head and bubble level are a nice touch. I do think it's way overpriced though. *** If this review was helpful, please let me know. Thanks *** :)
customer_reviews.author: Riley's Reviews

customer_reviews.title: it's a easy to use multi purpose tripod.
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice piece of kit. It's flexible and strong enough to be used in most situations. I use it with a Sony A6300 and 20mm lens most of the time and it haves't had a single issue. The ball head is decent and although I wish it used a more standard quick release plate it does the job. I even picked up a second ballhead just to make the switch from this to a full tripod swifter. All in all, it's a easy to use multi purpose tripod.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Keeler

customer_reviews.title: The Joby SLR Zoom is Great
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my iPhone 6s Plus and it is wonderful. whether I'm shooting handheld, or using the Joby as a tripod, it never fails. I was concerned by some reviews about breakage, but I have had zero problems. Of, course, I treat my equipment well and position the legs of the Joby slowly and keep the joints in their correct positions after each use. I really like this piece of kit!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Moore

customer_reviews.title: Got it Thanks to Casey Neistat!!!!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter heard about this item from one of her YouTube idols, Casey Neistat. It's an incredibly useful tripod for a film maker and will allow you to get shots and angles that you could not otherwise get. It seems to be very durable too.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Kelleher

customer_reviews.title: I really like this thing
customer_reviews.text: I really like this thing. I remember seeing them when they first cane out thinking this is stupid. But now that most videos I shot are either near the ground or when trying to get the birds eye view perspective eithout a drone this thing is nice. Now a leg joint popped out when I put alot of pressure on it by mistake which was a simple sliding it backinto the socket and good as new. For $35 this is a great tool for the bag
customer_reviews.author: Danny Perfect

customer_reviews.title: My favorite tripod. If I had to choose one tripod ...
customer_reviews.text: My favorite tripod. If I had to choose one tripod for the rest of my life it would probably be a Joby. It's so easy to carry anywhere and can be rigged up for any angle. It may take extra time to find your angle but for the size and portability it's worth it. I always strap it to the handlebars of my bike in case I need it when I go out. I also go out shooting "bagless" with very little gear. If I'm doing a specific project I may bring a larger tripod, but if I'm not sure what I'll be doing this one goes without question. The ball head is awesome and the build quality is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Jason S.

customer_reviews.title: Great item, but the quality...
customer_reviews.text: I really liked having this bad boy in my bag. Unfortunately, within the first 10 times of using it, one of the legs decided to snap off. Luckily I was standing by to catch my camera before walking away during my trip at Disney World. Such a bummer because I had multiple plans for this during my trip (and of course other time lapse stuff in the future), but this happened early on within the first couple days. Would love to have this in my bag again, but after already paying it's high price once, it's hard to justify repurchasing. I'd be happy to exchange the broken one for another, but we'll see. Hoping I just got unlucky.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great travel tripod
customer_reviews.text: Always wanted to have a travel tripod - and finally I have one. Small enough to fit in a backpack , but large enough to hold a DSLR ! This won't replace the sturdy carbon fibre professional grade tripods - but for most purposes will be more than enough. The tripod legs are strong but flexible. Luckily, I got the tripod along with a Joby Ballhead - and this combination works perfectly for most situations.
customer_reviews.author: Trishul

customer_reviews.title: Versatile but not as Durable as claimed
customer_reviews.text: A friend highly recommended this to me for taking nice DSLR pics on the fly. Versatile usability as well as durability were some of the selling points. Unfortunately after a year it broke, two of the legs just completely snapped off. I still haven't replaced because I'm afraid the same thing will happen. It was a great tool up until breaking.
customer_reviews.author: S. Murphy

product_meta.title: JOBY GorillaPod SLR Zoom. Flexible Tripod with Ballhead Bundle for DSLR and Mirrorless Cameras Up To 3kg. (6.6lbs).
product_meta.description: Size:GorillaPod Kit| Style:GorillaPod SLR Zoom KitTURN YOUR WORLD UPSIDE DOWN. Take previous limitations out of the equation with the GorillaPod SLR Zoom Tripod and Ballhead Bundle. The 360 pan gives you extra-versatility as increase the range of shots you’re capable of. There’s no room for hesitation when you unleash your creativity, which is why the quick release plate allows you to seamlessly transition when on the go. The flexible, wrappable legs will secure your camera up to 6.6 lbs. With over two dozen flexible joints, the legs will stay secure, even when you’re stuck between a rock and a hard place. The rubberized ring and footgrips keep your gear standing strong, or you can utilize the octopus style tripod to wrap around almost any structure, from fences to trees. Weighing less than 2 lbs. total, this ultra-light tripod and ballhead bundle fits easily in your camera bag or backpack, so you can take it virtually anywhere. COMPATIBILITY OPTIONS. Made out of durable, yet lightweight ABS plastic, zinc-aluminum, TPE Grip pads, and stainless steel, the JOBY GorillaPod SLR Zoom Tripod and Ballhead Bundle will never let your camera slip out of its grasp. Designed for SLR and mirrorless cameras up to 3 kg. (6 lbs.), you’ll get the sturdy structure you need, for the images you want. With a ¼”-20 thread standard tripod mount, you can easily use it with other JOBY tripods and stands. Give yourself the tools you need to take better photos and smoother videos with the GorillaPod SLR Zoom and Ballhead Bundle, the ultimate versatile tripod.
feature_bullets: STAND STRONG. Get crisper shots with this durable, lightweight tripod. The rubberized foot grips and wrappable legs will secure professional cameras up to 6.6lbs. as they hold their stance to any viable surface

CAPTURE SUPERIOR PERSPECTIVES. Look at life from a different point of view with the GorillaPod SLR Zoom Tripod and Ballhead Bundle. Easy maneuverability and precise positioning with 360 panning, to expand the range of shots you can capture

GROUND DOWN. Get ultra-stable and find your grounding with over two dozen leg joints and German TPE joins, so you’ll never have a shaky shot. The GorillaPod SLR Zoom can fiercely secure equipment up to 6.6 lbs., making the impossible shot, possible. Strong enough to hold a telephoto lens

SET UP WITH EASE. Take this lightweight SLR and mirrorless camera tripod anywhere. The quick release plate simply stays connected to your camera, so you can interchange with ease. Hold on tight with the 1/4”-20 standard tripod mount and 3/8” adapter

MADE TO LAST. Made of durable Japanese medical-grade ABS plastic, stainless steel, and German TPE, it’s made for the wear and tear of everyday life, or the rigor of adventure. Pair it with your mirrorless camera or SLR to capture the worthy moments of life

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars6,200 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
